Description: Limestone ostracon: on the recto a drawing in red ink of a standing Pharaoh presenting a libation offering. Behind him one line of hieroglyphic text. On the verso a sketch drawing in black ink of the head of a Pharaoh.
Curator's comments: For this type of drawing cf. Bengt E.J. Peterson, 'Zeichnungen aus einer Totenstadt' (Stockholm, 1973), pp. 14ff. For a drawing of a royal figure in the same hand cf. O. Cairo 25006 (G. Daressy, 'Ostraca' [Cairo 1901], p. 2 and p'. II). Bibliography: T.G.H. James, 'Egyptian Painting' (London, 1985), p. 45, fig 48; C.Keller, 'Bibliotheca Orientalis' 45 (1988), p.337.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393030) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393030)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2016 8 Mar-12 Jun, Cleveland, Cleveland Museum of Art, Pharoah: King of Egypt 2018 7 Jun-16 Sep, Barcelona, La Caixa, Pharaoh: King of Egypt 2018-2019 16 Oct-20 jan, Madrid, La Caixa, Pharaoh: King of Egypt 2020-2021 11 Feb - 21 Feb, Tarragona, La Caixa, Pharaoh: King of Egypt
